◆ etb_add_bus_handler()

int etb_add_bus_handler ( ETB *  etb,
void *  key,
dword  svr_mask,
dword  ev_mask,
void(ETB_CALLBACK *handler)(ETB *, int, dword, void *)  ,
void *  param 
)

Add a handler to the bus handler list.

Warning: Allocate Heap memory

Parameters
etbpointer to etel-bus structure
keythe key of the handler
svr_maskthe mask of the servers
ev_maskthe mask of the events
handlerhandler to add
paramthe parameters passed to handler
Returns
a negative value if an error or a timeout has occured
ETB_EAXESRECOVER Transnet established but axes not recovered
ETB_EBADCOMPRESSTOOL Unhandled compress tool
ETB_EBADDRIVER bad device driver installed
ETB_EBADDRVVER bad drive version
ETB_EBADFIRMWARE bad firmware file
ETB_EBADHOST bad host address
ETB_EBADLIBRARY function of external library not found
ETB_EBADMESSAGE bad message
ETB_EBADMODE bad drive mode
ETB_EBADOS function unavailable on OS
ETB_EBADPARAM bad parameter
ETB_EBADSERVER bad server found
ETB_EBADSTATE bad state
ETB_EBAUDRATE matching baudrate not found
ETB_EBOOTENTER cannot enter in boot mode
ETB_EBOOTFAILED boot failed
ETB_EBOOTHEADER bad boot header
ETB_EBOOTPASSWD boot password error
ETB_EBOOTPROG bad block programming
ETB_EBUSERROR bus in error state
ETB_EBUSRESET bus in reset state
ETB_ECHECKSUM checksum error
ETB_ECRC CRC error
ETB_EFLASHDEV unable to open flash device
ETB_EFLASHINFO unable to read flash information
ETB_EFLASHNOTLOCKED flash not locked
ETB_EFLASHPROTECTED flash protected
ETB_EFLASHREAD unable to read flash
ETB_EFLASHWRITE unable to write flash
ETB_EFLUSH Flush communication timeout
ETB_EFPGAFILENOTFOUND FPGA File not found
ETB_EFWDOWNLOAD Download firmware error. Refer to UA error code
ETB_EGPIODEV gpio device open error
ETB_EINTERNAL internal error
ETB_EMASTER master error
ETB_EMETAHEADER bad metadata header
ETB_EMETAHEADERVER bad metadata header version
ETB_EMETAPARSER Metedata parsing error
ETB_ENETWORK network error
ETB_ENODRIVE no drive present
ETB_ENOFILE File not found
ETB_ENOFWINPOOL Firmware not found in FW pool
ETB_ENOLIBRARY external library not found
ETB_EOBSOLETE function is obsolete
ETB_EOPENCOM open com error
ETB_EOPENSOCK open socket error
ETB_ERECTOSMALL size of received record too small
ETB_ERTVREADSYNCRO RTV read syncronisation error
ETB_ERTVWRITESYNCRO RTV write syncronisation error
ETB_ESERVER server error
ETB_ESOCKRESET socket reset
ETB_ESYSTEM system error
ETB_ETIMEOUT timeout error
ETB_ETOOSMALL size of record is too small
ETB_ETRANSNET Transnet is not established in imparted time
ETB_EUACSMSHMVER UA-CSM Shared memory version mismatch
ETB_EUNAVAILABLE function not available
ETB_EUNZIP Unable to unzip metadata buffer
ETB_EUSERFCTSTOP user function not stopped
ETB_EWFP Communication not opened(device in WaitForProgram)

◆ etb_begin_trans()

int etb_begin_trans ( ETB *  etb,
long  timeout 
)

Begins a transaction.

A ETB transaction will guarantee that the EETCOM records sent inside the transaction will not be mixed with other ETCOM record coming from another port.

Parameters
etbpointer to the etel-bus structure
timeoutthe maximum time for waiting access or INFINITE
Returns
a negative value if an error or a timeout has occured
ETB_EAXESRECOVER Transnet established but axes not recovered
ETB_EBADCOMPRESSTOOL Unhandled compress tool
ETB_EBADDRIVER bad device driver installed
ETB_EBADDRVVER bad drive version
ETB_EBADFIRMWARE bad firmware file
ETB_EBADHOST bad host address

◆ etb_csm_cmd_interface_set_fct()

int etb_csm_cmd_interface_set_fct ( ETB *  etb,
unsigned int  fctIdx,
ETB_SHM_CSM_FUNCTION  fct,
void *  user_param 
)

Attach the user function the the specified function index !!! Only available for Customer Software Module running on UltimET Advanced product After that, a user will be able to start the specified function by calling *JMP=fctIdx,threadIdx By calling *JMP=fctIdx,threadIdx, the function will then be executed inside the thread referenced by threadIdx If the specified thread already executes a function, the first function will be ended first, and replaced by the new one.

The function prototype has a first parameter allowing to stop the function:
typedef struct {
ebool stop_requested; // TRUE if the function must stop
} ETB_SHM_CSM_SYNCHRO_IFACE;
If the function is a long-term loop, it should be able to stop by checking the value pointed by stop_requested field of first function parameter.
This value pointed by stop_requested will be set to TRUE when the user enters a END=threadIdx

Parameters
etbpointer to etel bus structure
fctIdxthe index referencing the function (must be less than max_fct specified by function etb_csm_cmd_interface_create)
fcta pointer to the user function which will be called when user enter JMP=fctIdx,threadIdx
user_parama pointer to the user parameter which will be passed "as is" to the function
Returns
a negative value if an error or a timeout has occured
ETB_EAXESRECOVER Transnet established but axes not recovered
ETB_EBADCOMPRESSTOOL Unhandled compress tool
ETB_EBADDRIVER bad device driver installed
ETB_EBADDRVVER bad drive version
ETB_EBADFIRMWARE bad firmware file
ETB_EBADHOST bad host address
ETB_EBADLIBRARY function of external library not found
ETB_EBADMESSAGE bad message
ETB_EBADMODE bad drive mode
ETB_EBADOS function unavailable on OS
ETB_EBADPARAM bad parameter
ETB_EBADSERVER bad server found
ETB_EBADSTATE bad state
ETB_EBAUDRATE matching baudrate not found
ETB_EBOOTENTER cannot enter in boot mode
ETB_EBOOTFAILED boot failed
ETB_EBOOTHEADER bad boot header
ETB_EBOOTPASSWD boot password error
ETB_EBOOTPROG bad block programming
ETB_EBUSERROR bus in error state
ETB_EBUSRESET bus in reset state

ETB_ECRC CRC error
ETB_EFLASHDEV unable to open flash device
ETB_EFLASHINFO unable to read flash information
ETB_EFLASHNOTLOCKED flash not locked

ETB_EFLASHREAD unable to read flash
ETB_EFLASHWRITE unable to write flash

◆ etb_cyclic_watchdog()

int etb_cyclic_watchdog ( ETB *  etb,
ETB_CYCLIC_TYPES  cyclic_type,
ETB_RT_CHECKPOINT_TYPE  watchdog_type,
ETB_WATCHDOG_REACTION  watchdog_reaction,
double  watchdog_time 
)

Activate or deactivate the Cyclic watchdog on UltimET-Advanced product.


The watchdog let the UltimET check that the Cyclic user function is processed in the imparted time. If no, the UltimET will fall into error. !!! Only available on UltimET Advanced PCI/PCIe/CSM connection !!!
!!! For Ultimet Light, use etb_irq_watchdog !!!
On UltimET Advanced VxWorks CSM, the watchdog has a granularity of TransnET cycle 100us, therefore watchdog parameter cannot be less than 0.1, except 0 for disabling
On UltimET Advanced PCI or FreeRTOS CSM, the watchdog has a granularity of 10 ns, therefore watchdog parameter cannot be less than 0.00001, except 0 for disabling

Parameters
etbpointer to etel bus structure
cyclic_typethe Cyclic ID
  • SPI_CYCLIC_TYPE the SPI Cyclic handler
watchdog_typethe check point type where the watchdog will be active
  • ETB_RT_CHECKPOINT_TYPE_IRQ: Watchdog on IRQ acknowledge time
  • ETB_RT_CHECKPOINT_TYPE_USRAPP: Watchdog on USRAPP time
  • ETB_RT_CHECKPOINT_TYPE_EDI: Watchdog on EDI total time
watchdog_reactionthe kind of reaction if a watchdog is detected
  • ETB_WATCHDOG_REACTION_NONE: No reaction at all
  • ETB_WATCHDOG_REACTION_WARNING: Not usable
  • ETB_WATCHDOG_REACTION_ERROR: UltimET advanced falls in error
watchdog_timethe time in ms. 0 will disable the check
Returns
a negative value if an error or a timeout has occured
ETB_EAXESRECOVER Transnet established but axes not recovered
ETB_EBADCOMPRESSTOOL Unhandled compress tool
ETB_EBADDRIVER bad device driver installed
ETB_EBADDRVVER bad drive version
ETB_EBADFIRMWARE bad firmware file
ETB_EBADHOST bad host address

◆ etb_etcom_download_firmware()

int etb_etcom_download_firmware ( ETB *  etb,
eint64  axis_mask,
char *  firmware,
void(ETB_CALLBACK *user_fct)(int, int)   
)

Download specified firmware into specified axis.

This function is obsolete. It's recommended to use etb_etcom_download_firmware_ex instead.
Warning: Allocate Heap memory
Warning: Do not use to download firmware on UltimET advanced. Use etb_etcom_download_firmware_ex instead
This function uses 7zip feature: License
This function upgrades your firmware: License

This function first unzip the specified filename program (provided with EDI package).

  • On Windows, 7z.exe and 7z.dll (provided with EDI) must be present in you PATH environment variable.
  • On RTX & VxWorks-5.4, this functionnality is not available.
    Before using this function, use etb_change_boot_mode function to set the drives or ultimet in the good mode :
    • To download into a ultimet or a drive directly connected through TCP/IP, use
      etb_change_boot_mode(etb, ETB_BOOT_MODE_DIRECT);
    • To download into a drive directly connected through USB, use
      etb_change_boot_mode(etb, ETB_BOOT_MODE_BRIDGE);
    • To download into a drive via a UltimET, use
      etb_change_boot_mode(etb, ETB_BOOT_MODE_BRIDGE);
    • If the directly connected drive cannot be opened in RUN mode because he has download key, use USB connection and open it directly in good mode using
      etb_open(ETB *etb, driver, ETB_FLAG_BOOT_BRIDGE, baudrate, timeout).
      After download, use :
    • etb_change_boot_mode (etb, ETB_BOOT_MODE_RUN).
    Deprecated:
    since EDI-4.24A. Use etb_etcom_download_firmware_ex instead.
    Parameters
    etbpointer to etel bus structure
    axis_mask: the mask of the axis to download for example, if the specified firmware is a AccurET-400 firmware, all AccurET-400 axes specified in mask will be downloaded. If no AccurET-400 are specified in mask, function will do nothing and return 0
    firmware: the firmware file name (.far) to download
    user_fct: a user function which will be called each time 20 kbytes have been downloaded This function has 2 parameters first will be the block number, second will be the block downloaded percentage This function should not call any EDI functions If NULL is passed, no function will be called
    Returns
    a negative value if an error or a timeout has occured
    ETB_EAXESRECOVER Transnet established but axes not recovered

◆ etb_etcom_download_firmware_ex()

int etb_etcom_download_firmware_ex ( ETB *  etb,
eint64  axis_mask,
eint64  erase_mask,
char *  firmware,
ebool  md5_check,
int *  nb_downloaded_block,
void(ETB_CALLBACK *user_fct)(int, int, int, int, void *)  ,
void *  user 
)

Download specified firmware into specified axis.

Warning: Allocate Heap memory
This function uses 7zip feature: License
This function upgrades your firmware: License

For all blocks in .far file, the function checks if the block must be downloaded using the md5 algorithm. If the block must be downloaded, it is stored in a list. After checking all blocks, the function downloads the blocks stored in the list.
If the bus contains a drive in boot mode which must be downloaded, the block is downloaded without checking the md5.

This function first unzip the specified filename program (provided with EDI package).

  • On Windows, 7z.exe and 7z.dll (provided with EDI) must be present in you PATH environment variable.
  • On RTX & VxWorks-5.4, this functionnality is not available.
    Before using this function, use etb_change_boot_mode function to set the drives or ultimet in the good mode :
    • To download into a ultimet or a drive directly connected through TCP/IP, use
      etb_change_boot_mode(etb, ETB_BOOT_MODE_DIRECT);
    • To download into a drive directly connected through USB, use
      etb_change_boot_mode(etb, ETB_BOOT_MODE_BRIDGE);
    • To download into a drive via a UltimET, use
      etb_change_boot_mode(etb, ETB_BOOT_MODE_BRIDGE);
    • If the directly connected drive cannot be opened in RUN mode because he has download key, use USB connection and open it directly in good mode using
      etb_open(ETB *etb, driver, ETB_FLAG_BOOT_BRIDGE, baudrate, timeout).
      After download, use :
    • etb_change_boot_mode (etb, ETB_BOOT_MODE_RUN).
    Parameters
    etbpointer to etel bus structure
    axis_mask: the mask of the axis to download for example, if the specified firmware is a AccurET-400 firmware, all AccurET-400 axes specified in mask will be downloaded. If no AccurET-400 are specified in mask, function will do nothing and return 0
    erase_mask: ORed values of what must be erased
    • ETB_ERASE_PARAMETERS: Erase parameters
    • ETB_ERASE_SEQUENCES: Erase sequences or customer software module
    firmware: The firmware file name (.far) to download
    md5_checkFALSE: the download will be done without checking the MD5, and then will force the download of all blocks, even if already up-to-date
    nb_downloaded_blocka pointer on a variable which will receive:
    • -1: No blocks have been downloaded nor erased. The MD5 algorithm has detected that all blocks of the firmware are up-to-date.
    • 0: No blocks have been downloaded nor erased. Function has detected that no selected device are compatible with the specified firmware.
    • >0: The number of downloaded or erased blocks.
    user_fct: a user function which will be called each time 20 kbytes have been downloaded This function has 5 parameters:
    • the block number or -1 : Indicates that the MD5 analysis is in progress 0 : Indicates that the erasing of parameter and/or sequences blocks is in progress
    • the total number of blocks which will be downloaded
    • the current block current downloaded size
    • the current block size
    • a user parameter which will be passed as is If NULL is passed, no function will be called
    usera pointer to user value which will be returned as-is at each handler call.
    Returns
    a negative value if an error or a timeout has occured
    ETB_EAXESRECOVER Transnet established but axes not recovered
    ETB_EBADCOMPRESSTOOL Unhandled compress tool
    ETB_EBADDRIVER bad device driver installed
    ETB_EBADDRVVER bad drive version
    ETB_EBADFIRMWARE bad firmware file
    ETB_EBADHOST bad host address
    ETB_EBADLIBRARY function of external library not found
    ETB_EBADMESSAGE bad message
    ETB_EBADMODE bad drive mode

etbpointer to etel bus structure

◆ etb_etcom_sdiag()

char_cp  file_name,
int  line,
int  err,
ETB *  etb,
eint64  mask 
)

Put a diagnostic error message in a string.

Status of drive(s) specified by mask and stacktrace of EDI is printed out

Parameters
strthe string in which the diagnostic message is returned (should be long enough (1024 char))
file_namethe name of the application file in which the error occured
linethe line in the application file in which the error occured
errthe error returned by the EDI function
etbpointer to etel bus structure
maskthe mask of the axes for which status must be printed

◆ etb_fill_etcom()

int etb_fill_etcom ( ETB_ETCOM *  etcom,
int  max_param,
int  rec,
int  cmd,
char *  format,
  ... 
)

Create an ETCOM record from a format followed by arguments.

Parameters
etcoma pointer to the record which must be filled
max_paramthe maximal length of the record
recthe record number
cmdthe command number
formatthe format of the following arguments. In fact, the arguments are group of argument, The format can be s : for a string. First argument member is size, second is pointer on string r : for raw data. First argument member is size, second is pointer on data i : for integer 32 bits. First argument member is type, second is int32 value l : for integer 64 bits. First argument member is type, second is eint64 parameter f : for float 32 bits. First argument member is type, second is float32 value d : for double 64 bits. First argument member is type, second is double64 parameter Example :
Format = "is" => signifies one integer and one string. The arguments are in fact pair of argument : For integer : first argument is type (type means ETB_REC types) of data and second argument is the data itself For string : first argument is size of data, second argument is pointer of char*

◆ etb_host_file_gets()

int etb_host_file_gets ( ETB *  etb,
ETB_HOST_FILE *  filep,
char *  buffer,
size_t  buffer_size 
)

Read data from the file opened on a foreign host.

The function stops reading characters when end-of-file is reached or when a newline character is read, or when size-1 characters have been read, whichever comes first. The newline character is not discarded. A null character is placed immediately after the last character read into the array

Available on UltimET Advanced Customer software module ONLY.

Parameters
etbthe ultimET advanced bus
filepthe fpointer of the opened file
bufferthe buffer which will contain the read data

◆ etb_host_file_open()

int etb_host_file_open ( ETB *  etb,
const char *  filename,
char *  mode,
dword  flag,
ETB_HOST_FILE **  filep 
)

Open (and create) a file on a foreign host.

Used by Customer Software Module whose file system is user SD card managed by UltimET advanced firmware. As EDI does not currently provide any dirctory management, the user SD is seen as a single directory. Therefore all files will be created in root directory.

Available on UltimET Advanced Customer software module ONLY.

Parameters
etbthe UltimET advanced bus
filenamethe name of the file. No path are allowed
modethe mode in which the file will be opened
  • r Open in read mode
  • w Open in write mode (if the file already exists, its content will be erased)
  • a Open in append mode (write at the end of the file)
flagset of flag which can modify the host file functionalities
  • DSA_HOST_FILE_AUTOFLUSH_FLAG allows to force flush of file at each write
filepa pointer on pointer which will contain the opened file
Returns
a negative value if an error or a timeout has occured
ETB_EAXESRECOVER Transnet established but axes not recovered
ETB_EBADCOMPRESSTOOL Unhandled compress tool
ETB_EBADDRIVER bad device driver installed
ETB_EBADDRVVER bad drive version
ETB_EBADFIRMWARE bad firmware file
ETB_EBADHOST bad host address
ETB_EBADLIBRARY function of external library not found
ETB_EBADMESSAGE bad message
ETB_EBADMODE bad drive mode
ETB_EBADOS function unavailable on OS
ETB_EBADPARAM bad parameter
ETB_EBADSERVER bad server found
ETB_EBADSTATE bad state
ETB_EBAUDRATE matching baudrate not found
ETB_EBOOTENTER cannot enter in boot mode
ETB_EBOOTFAILED boot failed

◆ etb_host_file_printf()

int etb_host_file_printf ( ETB *  etb,
ETB_HOST_FILE *  filep,
const char *  format,
  ... 
)

Write into a file opened on a foreign host.

If file has been opened with DSA_HOST_FILE_AUTOFLUSH_FLAG flag, the content of the buffer will be really written in the file. This option slow down the write process but garants that the data are transmitted to the UA firmware and written in the file buffer. Otherwise, the data will be written in the file only when file buffer (4KB) is full or during file close operation.
The generated log will be truncated to 4095 characters.

Available on UltimET Advanced Customer software module ONLY.

◆ etb_irq_watchdog()

int etb_irq_watchdog ( ETB *  etb,
int  value 
)

Activate or deactivate the watchdog on UltimET product.


On UltimET, the watchdog let the UltimET check that each interrupt is acknowledge by PC in the specified elapsed time. If no, the UltimET will fall into error. !!! Only available on UltimET Light PCI/PCIe !!!
!!! For Ultimet Advanced, use etb_rtv_watchdog, or etb_cyclic_watchdog !!!

Parameters
etbpointer to etel bus structure
value:
  • on UltimET PCI/PCIe, the number of 30 ns packs that the UltimET accepts to pass without IRQ acknowledge.
  • on UltimET Advanced SHM, the number of 100us packs that the UltimET accepts to pass without IRQ acknowledge.
  • 0 will disable the check.
Returns
a negative value if an error or a timeout has occured
ETB_EAXESRECOVER Transnet established but axes not recovered
ETB_EBADCOMPRESSTOOL Unhandled compress tool
ETB_EBADDRIVER bad device driver installed
ETB_EBADDRVVER bad drive version

long  baudrate,
long  timeout,
ebool  deep 
)

This function will stop/or restart ETB thread.
Warning: Allocate Heap memory if called on UltimET bus

◆ etb_rtv_watchdog()

int etb_rtv_watchdog ( ETB *  etb,
int  rtv_id,
ETB_RT_CHECKPOINT_TYPE  watchdog_type,
ETB_WATCHDOG_REACTION  watchdog_reaction,
double  watchdog_time 
)

Activate or deactivate the RTV watchdog on UltimET-Advanced product.


The watchdog let the UltimET check that the RTV cyclic user function is processed in the imparted time. If no, the UltimET will fall into error. !!! Only available on UltimET Advanced PCIe/CSM connection !!!
!!! For Ultimet Light, use etb_irq_watchdog !!!
On UltimET Advanced VxWorks CSM, the watchdog has a granularity of TransnET cycle 100us, therefore watchdog parameter cannot be less than 0.1, except 0 for disabling
On UltimET Advanced PCI or FreeRTOS CSM, the watchdog has a granularity of 10 ns, therefore watchdog parameter cannot be less than 0.00001, except 0 for disabling

Parameters
etbpointer to etel bus structure
rtv_idthe RTV id (Actually only 0)
watchdog_typethe check point type where the watchdog will be active
  • ETB_RT_CHECKPOINT_TYPE_IRQ: Watchdog on IRQ acknowledge time
  • ETB_RT_CHECKPOINT_TYPE_USRAPP: Watchdog on USRAPP time
  • ETB_RT_CHECKPOINT_TYPE_EDI: Watchdog on EDI total time
watchdog_reactionthe kind of reaction if a watchdog is detected
  • ETB_WATCHDOG_REACTION_NONE: No reaction at all
  • ETB_WATCHDOG_REACTION_WARNING: Not usable
  • ETB_WATCHDOG_REACTION_ERROR: UltimET advanced falls in error
watchdog_timethe time in ms. 0 will disable the check
Returns
a negative value if an error or a timeout has occured
ETB_EAXESRECOVER Transnet established but axes not recovered
ETB_EBADCOMPRESSTOOL Unhandled compress tool
ETB_EBADDRIVER bad device driver installed
ETB_EBADDRVVER bad drive version

◆ etb_start_cyclic_handler()

int etb_start_cyclic_handler ( ETB *  etb,
ETB_CYCLIC_TYPES  cyclic_type,
int  rate,
ETB_CYCLIC_HANDLER  handler,
void *  user 
)

Start a cyclic handler.

!!! Only available on UlimET Advanced The specified handler will be called at each UltimET cyclic interrupt (if rate = 1). By specifying rate different than 1, the function will be called each "rate" * cyclic interrupt. Rate of 0 will disable the cyclic interrupt and thus disable the function call. The UltimET Advanced cyclic interrupt will occured each 100 us on standard configuration (This can be modified).

Parameters
etbpointer to etel bus structure
cyclic_typethe cyclic type. Actually, one cyclic type can be started:
  • SPI_CYCLIC_TYPE : A cyclic handler called when SPI data can be read from buffer
ratethe rate of the cyclic interrupt
  • 0 : disable cyclic interrupt "nr" and thus disable handler call
  • 1 : cyclic handler call appears each 100 us (by standard TransnET configuration>
  • 2 : cyclic handler call appears each 200 us (by standard TransnET configuration>
  • ...
handlerthe user function which will be called
usera pointer to user value which will be returned as-is at each handler call.
Returns
a negative value if an error or a timeout has occured
ETB_EAXESRECOVER Transnet established but axes not recovered
ETB_EBADCOMPRESSTOOL Unhandled compress tool
ETB_EBADDRIVER bad device driver installed
ETB_EBADDRVVER bad drive version

◆ etb_start_rtv_handler()

int etb_start_rtv_handler ( ETB *  etb,
int  nr,
int  rate,
int  delay,
ETB_RTV_HANDLER  handler,
void *  user 
)

Start a real-time handler.

!!! Only available on AccurET family devices connected through TransnET The specified handler will be called at each UltimET cyclic interrupt (if rate = 1). By specifying rate different than 1, the function will be called each "rate" cyclic interrupt. Rate of 0 will disable the cyclic interrupt and thus disable the function call. The UltimET cyclic interrupt will occured each 100 us on standard configuration (This can be modified). The cyclic interrupt can be delayed by "delay" * interrupt. Three cyclic interrupt can be used. Specify which one with nr parameter.

Parameters
etbpointer to etel bus structure
nrthe cyclic interrupt number "0 .. 2"
ratethe rate of the cyclic interrupt
  • 0 : disable cyclic interrupt "nr" and thus disable handler call
  • 1 : cyclic interrupt "nr" and handler call appears each 100 us (by standard TransnET configuration>
  • 2 : cyclic interrupt "nr" and hanlder call appears each 200 us (by standard TransnET configuration>
  • ...
delaythe delay between real UltimET cyclic interrupt and generated cyclic interrupt
  • 0 : no delay
  • 1 : 30 ns delay(by standard TransnET configuration>
  • 2 : 60 ns delay(by standard TransnET configuration>
  • ...
handlerthe user function which will be called. be aware that this function call will suspend ETB TransnET message handling. Thus, this function should avoid consuming too much time.
usera pointer to user value which will be returned as-is at each handler call.
Returns
a negative value if an error or a timeout has occured
ETB_EAXESRECOVER Transnet established but axes not recovered
ETB_EBADCOMPRESSTOOL Unhandled compress tool
ETB_EBADDRIVER bad device driver installed
ETB_EBADDRVVER bad drive version

◆ etb_translate_error()

char_cp etb_translate_error ( int  code)

Convert an error code into a textual error message.

Each function of the ETB library returns an integer (int) which represents the error code. If the operation ends with success, the function returns 0, otherwise it returns the number of the error represented by a negative number. This function enables the conversion of this error code into a textual error message in the form of a character string.

Parameters
codeThe error code returned by a dsa lib function.
Returns
A pointer to a string containing the error message.
Examples
compiler.c.

◆ etb_vfill_etcom()

int etb_vfill_etcom ( ETB_ETCOM *  etcom,
int  max_param,
int  rec,
int  cmd,
char *  format,
va_list  args 
)

Create an ETCOM record from a format followed by arguments.

Parameters
etcoma pointer to the record which must be filled
max_paramthe maximal length of the record
recthe record number
cmdthe command number
formatthe format of the following arguments. In fact, the arguments are group of argument, The format can be s : for a string. First argument member is size, second is pointer on string r : for raw data. First argument member is size, second is pointer on data i : for integer 32 bits. First argument member is type, second is int32 value l : for integer 64 bits. First argument member is type, second is eint64 parameter f : for float 32 bits. First argument member is type, second is float32 value d : for double 64 bits. First argument member is type, second is double64 parameter Example :
Format = "is" => signifies one integer and one string. The arguments are in fact pair of argument : For integer : first argument is type (type means ETB_REC types) of data and second argument is the data itself For string : first argument is size of data, second argument is pointer of char*
argsa pointer on the argument's list
